title: The Cars Frontman Ric Ocasek Dead at 75
text:
Photo: Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic

The Cars frontman Ric Ocasek, born Richard Theodore Otcasek, died Sunday, September 15 at the age of 75. His cause of death has yet to be released, but police were called to the singer’s Manhattan apartment Sunday afternoon, where he was pronounced dead, according to NBC 4 New York. Oscasek and his band were inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in 2018, after dominating the American pop scene throughout the 1980s with 13 Top 40 hits including “Just What I Needed,” “My Best Friend’s Girl” and “Good Times Roll.”

In addition to seven albums with the Cars, spanning from 1978’s The Cars to 2011’s Move Like This, the singer and producer released seven solo albums. Ocasek had six sons, including two with wife of 28 years model Paulina Porizkova, who announced their separation in 2018.
description: The Cars frontman Ric Ocasek has died at the age of 75 at his home in Manhattan. Ocasek and The Cars were inducted into the Rock And Roll Hall of Fame in 2018.
